hero.title: Load-test databases and services on top of k6
hero.description: Stroppy blends declarative scenarios, a custom k6 plugin and OpenTelemetry observability so you can plan regressions and compare configurations without hand-crafted environments.

tps.title: TPS trend
tps.subtitle: Average and p95 throughput across the latest runs

overview.title: What is Stroppy
overview.description: Stroppy is a load-testing and benchmarking platform for databases and services built on k6. Scenarios are described declaratively, executed via a custom plugin, and metrics are exported to OpenTelemetry.
overview.note: Useful for performance regression, capacity planning and comparing configurations.

capabilities.title: Key capabilities
capabilities.description: The Cloud Panel packages Stroppy mechanics and service workflows so you can launch scenarios without manually assembling an environment.

items.title: Declarative scenarios
items.description: A single protobuf config (steps, executors, exporters, DB driver) with generated Go and TypeScript models.

items.title: Execution on k6
items.description: The stroppy-xk6 plugin and ready TS scripts let you run tests without custom builds.

items.title: Metrics & tracing
items.description: Export to OpenTelemetry (gRPC/HTTP), ready-made Grafana dashboards and a VictoriaMetrics stack.

items.title: Scenario knowledge base
items.description: TPC-C profiles for PostgreSQL covering load, warmup and steady or ramp workloads.

items.title: Lifecycle automation
items.description: gRPC sidecars for initialization, step start/stop, teardown and extra checks.

items.title: Productive CLI
items.description: Step selection, ENV overrides, log levels and a single binary with embedded artifacts.

items.title: Reproducibility
items.description: Seeded datasets, explicit executor parameters (VUs, rate, max duration) and strict validation.

workflow.title: How it works
workflow.description: Describe the scenario in protobuf and let the panel orchestrate infrastructure, k6 execution and telemetry publishing.

steps.title: 1. Describe the experiment
steps.description: Configure global parameters, DB driver, metric exporters and the set of steps with executors in a declarative config.

steps.title: 2. Run the scenarios
steps.description: Stroppy builds the step context, prepares scripts and executes k6 via the embedded binary plugin.

steps.title: 3. Collect the signals
steps.description: Metrics and traces go to OpenTelemetry, while Grafana and VictoriaMetrics provide dashboards out of the box.

integrations.title: Integrations & ecosystem
integrations.description: Use familiar tools and extend the platform via open protocols.

items.title: k6/xk6
items.description: The load-testing engine plus the stroppy-xk6 plugin with ready TypeScript scripts.

items.title: Observability stack
items.description: OpenTelemetry, Grafana and VictoriaMetrics for metrics, logs and alerting.

items.title: gRPC & Protobuf
items.description: Scenario definitions and sidecar hooks in strict schemas with generated clients.

items.title: PostgreSQL profiles
items.description: Ready TPC-C cases and a driver that supports load, warmup and comparison flows.

audience.title: Who benefits
audience.description: Stroppy supports performance engineers, database teams and developers who ship performance gates.
items: Performance engineers and SREs running regressions and capacity planning.
Database teams comparing configurations and tuning clusters.
Developers wiring load gates into CI/CD.

reasons.title: Why it feels convenient
items: Fast start: one binary, ready scripts and dashboards.
Transparent configs: strict schema, ENV overrides and validation.
Extensibility: DB drivers, sidecar services, custom steps and metrics.

bundle.title: Included out of the box
items: The stroppy CLI, stroppy-xk6 plugin and TypeScript scripts.
TPC-C scenarios for Postgres and a curated profile library.
OTEL export plus an observability example (Grafana + VictoriaMetrics).

about.title: About Stroppy
about.description: Stroppy is a framework for testing various types of databases. It allows you to deploy a cluster in the cloud, run load tests and simulate different failures, such as network unavailability of one of the nodes in the cluster.
about.techDescription: To complicate the task for the DBMS, Stroppy may try to deliberately break the DB cluster, because in the real world failures happen much more often than we want.

benefits.1: Deployment of a cluster of virtual machines in the cloud
benefits.3: Deployment of the selected DBMS in a running cluster
benefits.4: Collecting statistics from Grafana k8s cluster metrics
benefits.5: Managing test parameters and the deployment
benefits.6: Running tests on demand from CLI

benefits: Deployment of a cluster of virtual machines in the cloud
Deployment of the selected DBMS in a running cluster
Collecting statistics from Grafana k8s cluster metrics
Managing test parameters and the deployment
Running tests on demand from CLI

cta.title: Ready to run a fair benchmark?
cta.description: Spin up an environment, select a TPC-C profile or your own protobuf scenario and compare results against previous runs.

footer.description: Stroppy is a platform for database load testing and benchmarking: protobuf scenarios, a custom k6 plugin and a ready observability stack.

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.mainDescription: Complete guide to using the platform for database and cloud application load testing
